Class Bot

java.lang.Object
MRILib.managers.Bot
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArmBotEasy, ArmBotFF
public class Bot extends Object
Base Robot Hardware Manager and Controller

This class manages the core hardware components of a typical FTC robot, focusing on the drivetrain, odometry, IMU, and essential utilities. It provides a standardized interface for initializing and interacting with these components.

This implementation specifically uses a 4-motor Mecanum drive train and the

invalid reference 
GoBildaPinpointDriver
for odometry via an I2C device. It can be adapted for different odometry systems (e.g., wheel encoders, 3-wheel dead odometry) by modifying the odo variable initialization and ensuring method compatibility.

This class serves as a superclass for more specific robot configurations, like ArmBotEasy, which adds control for manipulators (arms, claws, etc.). While subclasses handle unique mechanisms, this base Bot class aims to remain consistent across different robot designs, requiring only adjustments to initialization parameters in

invalid reference 
BotValues
.

See Also:
  • ArmBotEasy
  • invalid reference 
    GoBildaPinpointDriver
  • invalid reference 
    BotValues

  • Constructor Details

    • Bot

      public Bot(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Constructs a Bot instance, initializing drive motors, IMU, odometry, and voltage sensor. Uses default hardware map names ("frontLeft", "frontRight", etc.).
      Parameters:
      hm - The HardwareMap from the OpMode, used to retrieve hardware devices.

  • Method Details

    • initMotors

      private void initMotors(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Initializes the drive motors using default hardwareMap names ("frontLeft", "frontRight", "backLeft", "backRight"). Calls the overloaded version initMotors(HardwareMap, String, String, String, String).
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.

    • initMotors

      private void initMotors(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm, String fl, String fr, String bl, String br)
      Initializes the drive motors with specified hardwareMap names and sets their directions. Motors are typically set to DcMotor.RunMode.RUN_WITHOUT_ENCODER initially, but directions are set based on
      invalid reference 
      BotValues
      .
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.
      fl - Front left drive motor name in the configuration file.
      fr - Front right drive motor name in the configuration file.
      bl - Back left drive motor name in the configuration file.
      br - Back right drive motor name in the configuration file.

    • initIMU

      public void initIMU(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Initializes the Control Hub's IMU using the default hardwareMap name ("imu"). Calls the overloaded version initIMU(HardwareMap, String).
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.

    • initIMU

      public void initIMU(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm, String name)
      Initializes the Control Hub's IMU with a specified hardwareMap name and orientation parameters defined in
      invalid reference 
      BotValues
      (LOGO_DIR, USB_DIR).
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.
      name - The name of the IMU device in the hardware configuration file.

    • initOdo

      public void initOdo(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm)
      Initializes the GoBilda Pinpoint Odometry Computer using the default hardwareMap name ("odo"). Calls the overloaded version initOdo(HardwareMap, String).
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.

    • initOdo

      public void initOdo(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap hm, String name)
      Initializes the GoBilda Pinpoint Odometry Computer with a specified hardwareMap name. Sets necessary parameters like offsets, resolution, and encoder directions based on hardware setup. Resets the initial pose to (0, 0) with 0 heading.
      Parameters:
      hm - OpMode's HardwareMap.
      name - The name of the Pinpoint device in the hardware configuration file.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the robot's state. Called periodically in the main OpMode loop. This method reads the latest data from the odometry device, updates the stored currentPosition and lastPosition, and updates drive motor encoder readings.

    • updateEncoders

      public void updateEncoders()
      Updates the stored encoder positions for the drive train motors. Saves the previous tick's values and reads the current values. This method is called by update().

    • getFL

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx getFL()
      Returns:
      The front left drive motor instance (DcMotorEx).

    • getFR

      Returns:
      The front right drive motor instance (DcMotorEx).

      Returns:
      The back left drive motor instance (DcMotorEx).

    • getBR

      public com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx getBR()
      Returns:
      The back right drive motor instance (DcMotorEx).

    • getFLPos

      public int getFLPos()
      Returns:
      The last read encoder position of the front left motor. Call updateEncoders() first for the latest value.

    • getFRPos

      public int getFRPos()
      Returns:
      The last read encoder position of the front right motor. Call updateEncoders() first for the latest value.

    • getBLPos

      public int getBLPos()
      Returns:
      The last read encoder position of the back left motor. Call updateEncoders() first for the latest value.

    • getBRPos

      public int getBRPos()
      Returns:
      The last read encoder position of the back right motor. Call updateEncoders() first for the latest value.

    • getFLPosPrev

      public int getFLPosPrev()
      Returns:
      The encoder position of the front left motor from the *previous* updateEncoders() call.

    • getFRPosPrev

      public int getFRPosPrev()
      Returns:
      The encoder position of the front right motor from the *previous* updateEncoders() call.

    • getBLPosPrev

      public int getBLPosPrev()
      Returns:
      The encoder position of the back left motor from the *previous* updateEncoders() call.

    • getBRPosPrev

      public int getBRPosPrev()
      Returns:
      The encoder position of the back right motor from the *previous* updateEncoders() call.

    • getIMUHeading

      public double getIMUHeading()
      Gets the robot's current heading (yaw) from the IMU. Note: This value is negated to likely align with standard FTC coordinate systems (counter-clockwise positive).
      Returns:
      The robot's heading in degrees.

    • resetIMUHeading

      public void resetIMUHeading()
      Resets the IMU's yaw angle to zero based on the current orientation.

    • getPosition

      public Pose2D getPosition()
      Gets the robot's current position and heading as estimated by the odometry system. This value is updated during the update() call.
      Returns:
      The current
      invalid reference 
      Pose2D
      (position in inches, heading in degrees).

    • getLastPosition

      public Pose2D getLastPosition()
      Gets the robot's position and heading from the *previous* update cycle. Useful for calculating displacement or velocity.
      Returns:
      The
      invalid reference 
      Pose2D
      from the last call to update().

    • getOdoPosition

      private Pose2D getOdoPosition()
      Gets the raw position directly from the GoBilda Pinpoint driver. Note: This might not be synchronized with the main update() cycle. Use getPosition() for the synchronized pose.
      Returns:
      The
      invalid reference 
      Pose2D
      currently reported by the odometry driver.

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Gets the current estimated X-coordinate of the robot. Convenience method for getPosition().getX(DistanceUnit.INCH).
      Returns:
      The X-coordinate in inches.

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Gets the current estimated Y-coordinate of the robot. Convenience method for getPosition().getY(DistanceUnit.INCH).
      Returns:
      The Y-coordinate in inches.

    • getHeading

      public double getHeading()
      Gets the current estimated heading of the robot. Convenience method for getPosition().getHeading(AngleUnit.DEGREES). By default, this uses the heading from the
      invalid reference 
      GoBildaPinpointDriver
      .
      Returns:
      The heading in degrees.

    • getVoltage

      public double getVoltage()
      Gets the current battery voltage reported by the first available voltage sensor.
      Returns:
      The current battery voltage in Volts.

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(double x, double y, double heading)
      Sets the robot's current position and heading in the odometry system. Overloads setPosition(Pose2D) for convenience.
      Parameters:
      x - The desired X-coordinate (in inches).
      y - The desired Y-coordinate (in inches).
      heading - The desired heading (in degrees).

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Pose2D pos)
      Overrides the current position tracked by the GoBilda Pinpoint Odometry Computer. Useful for setting the starting pose at the beginning of autonomous.
      Parameters:
      pos - The desired
      invalid reference 
      Pose2D
      to set as the current position.

    • setDirections

      public void setDirections()
      Sets the direction of the drive motors based on the constants defined in
      invalid reference 
      BotValues
      (LEFTDIR, RIGHTDIR). Ensures positive power corresponds to forward motion for all wheels.

    • setMode

      public void setMode(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode mode)
      Sets the DcMotor.RunMode for all four drive motors simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      mode - The desired DcMotor.RunMode (e.g., RUN_USING_ENCODER, RUN_WITHOUT_ENCODER, STOP_AND_RESET_ENCODER).

    • resetEncoders

      public void resetEncoders()
      Resets the drive motor encoders to 0 without changing their current DcMotor.RunMode. Also resets the stored previous encoder tick values.

    • resetPrevEncoders

      public void resetPrevEncoders()
      Resets the stored *previous* encoder tick values to zero. Called internally by resetEncoders().

    • enableBrakeMode

      public void enableBrakeMode(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables the "brake" zero power behavior for all drive motors. When enabled (true), motors will actively resist movement when commanded power is zero. When disabled (false), motors will coast or "float". Uses constants BRAKE and FLOAT from
      invalid reference 
      BotValues
      .
      Parameters:
      enabled - Set to true to enable brake mode, false to enable float mode.

    • driveXYW

      public void driveXYW(double rx, double ry, double rw)
      Drives the robot using robot-centric Cartesian coordinates (x, y) and rotation (w). Calculates the required power for each Mecanum wheel based on the desired movement vector and rotation rate. Powers are scaled to stay within [-1, 1] and adjusted for battery voltage.
      Parameters:
      rx - Forward/Backward power (-1 to 1). Positive is typically forward.
      ry - Strafe Left/Right power (-1 to 1). Positive is typically right.
      rw - Rotational power (-1 to 1). Positive is typically counter-clockwise.

    • driveFieldXYW

      public void driveFieldXYW(double fx, double fy, double fw)
      Drives the robot using field-centric Cartesian coordinates (x, y) and robot-centric rotation (w). Takes desired movement relative to the field (forward, strafe) and desired rotation rate, rotates the movement vector based on the robot's current heading, and then calls driveXYW(double, double, double) with the robot-centric commands.
      Parameters:
      fx - Field Forward/Backward power (-1 to 1). Positive is away from the driver wall.
      fy - Field Strafe Left/Right power (-1 to 1). Positive is typically right relative to the field.
      fw - Robot Rotational power (-1 to 1). Positive is typically counter-clockwise.
